en: Public speaking has never been your forte, and now it feels as though your entire dream is riding on it. Rationalize as you might, there's some part of you that feels like this might be your only chance to get this thing off the ground. You know there's a community college that offers workshops in public speaking, but they're expensive at $600. Enroll?

You enroll in the workshop and spend the day listening to others speak and speaking to them. Surprisingly, you learn more from listening to others. Now you have an idea of what to avoid during your presentation.

You decide against it, reasoning that it's too expensive. But the fact that you turned it down hovers in your mind at night. What if you fail the presentation, all because you didn't attend the workshop? The regret clings to you, no matter how irrational you tell yourself you're being.
